1.title: Summary span too long
1.text:
summary sentence should be divided into two sub-spans:
  1. The signing of the relief bill.
  2. The president's statement

2.title: Summary span too long
2.text:
For now, highlight only:
"President Reagan signed a $3.9 billion disaster relief bill".

Do the rest later.

3.title: Summary span too long
3.text:
For now, highlight only:
"a $3.9 billion disaster relief bill aimed at helping drought-stricken farmers recover".

Do the rest later.

4.title: Summary span too long
4.text:
For now, highlight only:
"while stating ``This bill isn't as good as rain,''".

Do the rest later.

5.title: "while" association.
5.text: Highlighting "while" is more appropriate with ensuing part of the sentence rather than the preceding.

4.title: Missing info in document alignment
4.text: You should also highlight "<u>Reagan said</u>" in the document.

5.title: Implicit presence of "while"
5.text:
Since there isn't an actual alignment to "while", it should be saved unaligned (see tutorial for further info).
In this case, it also makes sense to include it with the the part of the sentence coming after it ('starting "This bill....').

Check out parapraph 3.
